pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [f909708048](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17015/commits/f9097080486fe23ff2e7be7fc5ac23d36b3ca5df)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ toGameEmbedding`
`+ toGame_eq_iff`
`+ toGame_injective`
`+ toGame_le_iff`
`+ toGame_lf_iff`
`+ toGame_lt_iff`
`+ toGame_one`
`+ toGame_zero`
`+ toPGame_one`
`+ toPGame_zero`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by loefflerd.

Please merge master and fix the build

bors d+

:v: vihdzp can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Not being able to use `‚ßè` is really annoying... This was probably discussed before, but is the convention to avoid `open`ing both `Game` and `PGame` at the same time? I guess in this case adding `PGame.` in a bunch of places isn't worth one use of `‚ßè`, but I'm a bit uncomfortable with not always using notation.

In truth I'm not actually sure we should have `LF`. Originally, this predicate had to be defined alongside the usual `‚â§` relation through mutual induction. But this is no longer needed thanks to Junyan Xu's game induction relation. So really `LF x y` is the same as `not y ‚â§ x`, which has no sort of dedicated notation on any other type.
I assume this is a discussion for future developments, and shouldn't be seen as an obstacle to merging this PR?
Yes this is just the first time I'm seeing this part of the library and was wondering about it. Definitely won't be changed right now.

pullRequest.title: feat(SetTheory/Game/Birthday): basic API for `Ordinal.toGame`
